Compare two
instances, optionally using a timeline that does not start at
00:00:00:00. Timeline length and wrap point is determined by the
property. The timeline is considered linear for 24 hours (or
100 days) from this start time, wrapping around the upper limit.

If all subsequently smaller component values are already 0 then no
change is made of course.
Passing
has no effect, as it is the smallest component.
